main event: A bright light in the sky over Dayton, Ohio, moving at high speed, was reported by an observer on May 5, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, round, solid object with no wings or tail, moving at high speed.
The observer, an experienced air traffic controller, stated the object was not an aircraft under his control.
The object was sighted for 20-30 minutes and seemed to be maneuvering before disappearing behind clouds.
Other similar sightings of a bright light in the sky were reported in the Dayton area around the same time.
The Air Force was unable to conclusively identify the object, but suggested it may have been an experimental or secret military craft.
sighted object: a bright, round, solid object with no wings or tail
